mdRecord.dcterms:title: General Washington's Old Stable and Carriage House at Mount Vernon
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Johnson, N. G. (Newton G.)
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Stereoscopic view of stable at Mount Vernon. Mounted on orange board. The publisher's imprint on the front of the stereograph mount reads: N. G. Johnson, Photographer, 309 9th St., Washington, D. C. Only Authorized Publisher of Mount Vernon Views. The adhered label on the reverse reads: General Washington's Old Stable and Carriage House at Mount Vernon, Built in 1745 by Lawrence Washington, of brick imported from England, and notable for its peculiar style of architecture and commodious dimensions. N. G. Johnson, Photographer, 426 7th St., Washington, D. C. Only authorized Publisher of Mount Vernon Views. Stamped in faint blue ink - Copyright 1880 by the Mount Vernon Association.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
George Washington's Mount Vernon
Outbuilding
